website_summaries.verdict: A dependable and versatile dial caliper at a price that fits easily into anyone's budget.
pros: Gives readings in inches and millimeters
Takes inside, outside, step, and depth measurements
Smooth sliding action with no sticking
cons: Some complain the caliper will not work correctly after it has been dropped

customer_reviews.title: Mine does say shock proof. Well its not...
customer_reviews.text: I can say that they did work well. I prefer mechanical over a digital caliper all day, every day. HOWEVER, the caliper fell from my desk ONCE and was misaligned. Due to it being dual readings I couldn't just adjust the bezel to the arm, it even bound up gears at certain point's and will refuse to adjust without more than necessary force. Im not sure if i should get in contact with them for a replacement or not. I 'm not sure if i want a dual caliper again after this experience. Nor if it would be covered.
customer_reviews.author: Pen pall 2232

customer_reviews.title: If you need a GREAT caliper but don't want to spend 200 dollars, get this . . .
customer_reviews.text: Operated very smooth out of the box and received the right unit labeled "Anytime tools, shockproof".It came with its own carrying case and cutout.I compared it to a Mitutoyo digital caliper and measured .030",.050", and .070" sheet metal.Mine was a thousandth of an inch off so very good for a 30 dollar caliper.I expect this to last for a long time with proper care and wont have to worry about batteries :).
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not shock proof
customer_reviews.text: dont waste hundreds of dollars buying junk calipers after calipers, literally all of them are trash. Just get mitutoyo. I thought mechanical calipers would cure my woes of dead battery digitial calipers, but when you have to baby a tool, its not a good tool. The end stop is a plastic bumper and it broke, allowing the pinion to loose teeth and hence render the dail useless and there is no easy way to reset it. Im actually pissed off.
customer_reviews.author: SpectrHz

customer_reviews.title: Good, affordable caliper
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice caliper that works smoothly and accurately. I tried a digital caliper and didn't like it, so went back to the "analog" dial-type unit and have been very satisfied. Unless you are a machinist that needs "perfect" (sub .001") accuracy, this unit will serve you well... only reason for 4 stars is that I have used a friend's Starrett caliper and that is a "cadillac" but much much more expensive. If you don't have an unlimited budget, this is a good unit and a recommended buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer - Warren

customer_reviews.title: Dial is easy to read and you get inches and millimeters
customer_reviews.text: Very happy to find calipers that do inches and centimeters/millimeters. And the dial is easier to read than the slider type is. The weird thing is the metric rule on top reads as expected. The inch slider on bottom sometimes trip me up. Is the slider BEFORE the line? AFTER the line? ON the line? I can't always tell. Funny - I don't have the same problem with the metric slider even though they're on the same piece of metal. Fortunately, this device has both inches and millimeters. Whenever I'm in doubt, I read them both and convert them. Its a good way to check if you've read it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Anaeee

customer_reviews.title: Good calipers for reloading / everyday use
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I plan on using these for reloading and find my digital calipers frusturating to use as the distance flucuates with pressure on the turning dial, not much but enough that I dont like them and I'm always concerned about the batteries in them. In any case, I set these up and they seem to much easier to read. Although slightly less accurate, I presume, being manual instead of digital they are well within acceptable tolerances. Since I've not used these extensively yet I did not give 5 stars but my feeling is that they will be and I'll be updating my review.
customer_reviews.author: FGOrr

customer_reviews.title: Good calipers for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems with the accuracy or operation. They are nice and sturdy, easy to read and easy to adjust. These are the first calipers that I have ever owned and I was up and running in no time. After reading about all of the issues with the electronic ones, I decided to go old school. They suit my purposes just fine. My only complaint is that, out of the box, the zero setting was very noticeably off. It would be nice if the manufacturer built them closer to the desired alignment to begin with. As I said above, the adjustment was easy and holds once set. -mgp
customer_reviews.author: Emily Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does a pretty consistent accurate read and consistent on repeating "0" (zero) setting. Granted, it isn't like my old Mitutoyo Dial Calipers, but it also doesn't cost the same either. Also wanted to point out the obvious; the case itself is cheap. Don't plan on the inserted foam contours to last during use, with the sharp edges around the calipers. Especially if you're using these calipers quite frequently. The plastic case button is not that effective either. I store the case/caliper within the white cardboard box sleeve that housed the case when I'm finished. Still, would recommend....
customer_reviews.author: Integrity

customer_reviews.title: Never knew how useful it was until I got one
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of battery calipers, which are fine when you have fresh batteries available. I have grown accustomed to using my old dial caliper a lot more, but it was only inches and I got tired of converting to metric all the time (something that battery calipers have an advantage, in that they can just switch scales, when they work). I bought this one and I am really impressed by the quality, accuracy, repeatability, and precision. Being able to read out mm alongside inches in a single tool is great.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable Dial Caliper
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for 2 months, now. Very well made-- has a sturdy, smooth feel. Someone commented about inaccurate or varying zero-- I've never seen that. My black (inch) and red (mm) dial arms always align perfectly at zero. Yes, I do miss the dial that shows you 64th's of an inch directly (so you can immediately read common lengths like 3/8"). Some other calipers have this kind of a dial. But I've noticed that most specs that require caliper level measurements use decimal point measurements of inches (like .460 inches). I guess if you want to know if something is 3/8", you use a tape measure or do the calculation from decimal to fraction.
customer_reviews.author: Adult Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good set of calipers
customer_reviews.text: My old calipers finally broke. I am not interested in spending a fortune, but accuracy is important. I usually buy calipers from a local aviation surplus store. They were all sold out. I saw these and they are Great quality for the money and quick conversion without calculation. So no batteries required and no calculator required.
customer_reviews.author: don wilson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived further out of calibration than any set of calipers I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: They do work. Almost a commodity, standardized product, so that's good. Not like there's a lot of cutting edge tech here. Out of the box, the indicator was already skewed about 60 degrees from vertical. Not confidence inspiring. Wonder if this was shipping (still unimpressive for the product) or poor QC. I like the dials because they're so reliable... But I can't bring myself to trust these. I keep these in the garage "for reference."
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, excellent, excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. For those of you who are not used to an analogue caliper, the instructions are very good. NO BATTERIES REQUIRED! The no-batteries feature was key for me - I want calipers that I can use very infrequently and not find out the batteries are dead. If needed, it is very easy to adjust the bezel to zero which displays thousandths of an inch. Comes in a well-made, foam-padded, plastic case. I filed down the three clasps on the case to make it easier to open.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Ruddy

customer_reviews.title: Very handy to have both inches and cm on one caliper
customer_reviews.text: This is a great combo caliper - inches and metric. You can read both values at the same time, so it's trivial to convert a measurement to inches or mm/cm. The dial has 2 needles, black one for inches (.01 per tick) and red one for mm (0.02 per tick). The red one runs about 2.5 times are 'fast' as the black when you move the caliper jaws, as you would expect (2.54 cm = 1.00 inch). Now if I could find one that had inches in fractions (1/4, etc.) instead of decimal parts-of-an-inch -- that would be a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: tdir-tdir

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Don’t judge by the low price! I also own Brown & Sharpe & Mitoyo brands in both dial and digital, and don’t see any difference in quality. This is a fine tool. I used it most of the day on some lathe work and have good reason to trust it’s accuracy. This is my first dial type with both metric and SAE readings. That’s a huge plus. This is now my “go to caliper”, right on top of my box. Try it, you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: Durable Stainless Dialer-Upper ~
customer_reviews.text: Good price, good pack, fast ship. This is a good quality caliper with all the functionality you should need as a home-based DIY'r. All stainless steel construction with good tooth rack and smooth operation. Depth/plunge measurement, along with inside and outside diameter measure, should take care of all your needs. Good-size dial reads out in inches and millimeters, and the ink along the slide rack is nicely visible. Basic plastic case provides form-fitting foam interior, cut to shape, and the latch holds it closed pretty well. Good value for the money ~
customer_reviews.author: leopold alabaster

customer_reviews.title: Plastic bottom retainer bar on back side.
customer_reviews.text: It's a quality tool with one cheap part. The reason there are no pics of the back is because the bar that keeps the slide in at the bottom is made of a printed plastic when it should be metal. The roller wheel base is all metal, not plastic, which kept me from sending it back. Took a metal bar from a cheaper caliper and replaced the plastic with it for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive Caliper to use at home in my 3D Printing space. These are a happy medium between the really junky hobbyist ones and true machinist calipers. I can see these lasting a long time. The storage case is also very nice. Nothing special, but sturdy. I checked the accuracy against a set of gauge blocks and I was getting very consistent, on point measurements. Very happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: Carly R Taylor Parnell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for quality and accuracy, just don’t drop em
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of my favorite tools in my tool box, pretty accurate, the point where it gets inaccurate you should probably be using micrometers and not calipers, it’s still impressive that they were accurate to about 0.002 with good repeatability. This should kinda go without saying but they are not robust, this is my second caliper, first one was dropped from about 5 ft and they were completely wrecked, so just be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing, and no batteries
customer_reviews.text: I got sick of going to use my digital dial calipers and finding the batteries dead constantly. Took a chance on this thing, and I love it. I'm not measuring things super precisely most of the time, but it does seem that this caliper can handle that. The inch and metric functionality is pretty sweet. I do not have another similar caliper to compare this to, but I won't be buying any more digital calipers after this one.
customer_reviews.author: bcstyle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!! Decent even  vs mitatoyo
customer_reviews.text: Been using these in my machine shop class and man the're great! So far they are spot on accurate. They are pretty smooth. Not as smooth at the new mitatoyo's the class has but just as accurate. I find myself using these more than The class sets because it's less worry of potentially dropping and breaking the expensive ones, I dont have to share them, they read metric, decent case. Really no bad thing to say about them, for the price, amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Received the caliper today. All the right stuff happened, based on what I read in other reviews - the jaws were slightly open for shipping. No light showed between jaws when I closed them. The dial returned consistently to zero when I measured a few things. For my purposes this should be a completely adequate instrument. Will post later if I find otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: A. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: don't leave in case, foam padding deteriorates
customer_reviews.text: Bought October 17, 2017. Used infrequently, and have seen no problems with function, otherwise sits in toolbox in the house. The foam lining the plastic case has begun to stick to the caliper. A mess on the back of the movable part, and on the dial face cover. Blech.
customer_reviews.author: tech hater

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this Caliper!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this dual caliper.. mine works perfect, came finished as nice as most, keeps zero fine, and is super handy when I work on items that have both metric and standard on them.. No problems whatsoever, the plastic storage box was tight and hard to open, a little sandpaper on the plastic latch tab and it works fine. Use this daily in gunsmithing, and I would get the same if anything happened to this one..
customer_reviews.author: Lxmyth

customer_reviews.title: Double-check the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how easy it's supposed to be for the needle to get rotated, but definitely read the directions and follow them. You will almost certainly need to rotate the dial face at some point. Also, these aren't trivial to read. Take your time, do it right. But, on the plus side, no batteries at all. That's a win!
customer_reviews.author: minifig

customer_reviews.title: Dual read 6 inch (15 cm) linear caliper.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of the ability to see metric and standard measurements on a dial caliper. But I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of this tool. Measurement repeatability was excellent. Reading metric and standard at the same time was not a problem. Just match the correct pointer to the correct scale and you have your reading plust the conversion to the other reading with no batteries required or button pushing.
customer_reviews.author: Bloodloss

customer_reviews.title: Who needs batteries? Not me!
customer_reviews.text: Many of the woodworkers and "makers" I follow online have digital calipers, so when I was in the market for such a tool, I started there. Then I saw dial calipers and realized that if I'm ok spending an extra half-second whenever I make a precise measurement, I can save a few bucks on the calipers and tons of money over time on batteries. I bought this one because it was affordable, it has inches and metric readouts, it comes in a protective case, and I never have to buy a battery for the thing. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: sc0tlas

customer_reviews.title: Work perfectly after 7 years of daily use
customer_reviews.text: This is my most used tool. It is one of the few tools that sit on my desk for quick, easy access (along with a fountain pen, HP12C calculator, mouse, and keyboard. I purchased it 7 years ago. Still zeroes on both SAE and metric. I use the push, pull, and plunger features to measure. I haven't found a situation where I can't get the measurement I need. I like not being reliant on batteries.
customer_reviews.author: jhm74

customer_reviews.title: Stiffer than Mitutoyo
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is very useful. The only downside seems to be that it is stiffer than my Mitutoyo making it a bit harder to move it to the exact measurement. Given the large price difference, that is not a big issue. It seems to be accurate. It seems to track the Mitutoyo by about +/- 0.001
customer_reviews.author: mhubel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, not incredibly accurate
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, not incredibly accurate, but pretty nice for the price. There is a minor but visible imprecision in the rmeasurements and the return to zero, maybe the width of one of the lines, nothing major, but if you're doing super-precise work, you might need something better. This is fine for general shop use, and it's my go-to for measuring random nuts and bolts and round things in general. It's nice to have the two scales in one tool. Good value, if it holds up. With the two whirling needles, I open and close it very gently, which seems prudent.
customer_reviews.author: isiton?

customer_reviews.title: Dual gauge is perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Well made, can finally use same caliper for inch and metric! Instructions say it was inspected with NIST certified equipment, but no separate NIST certificate was included. I have received a separate certificate for other NIST certified equipment. No big deal for me, a nonprofessional user.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: LOOK & WORK GREAT. CHEAPER THAN MOST MAIL ORDER CATALOGS
customer_reviews.text: HELLO. LOOK & WORK GREAT . CHEAPER THAN MOST MAIL ORDER CATALOGS . I BOUGHT SPARES . I'M ALWAYS BREAKING OR LOSING THEM. I'VE BEEN A MACHINIST FOR 35 YRS . THERE A GOOD QUALITY . I LIKE DIAL OVE ELECTRONIC . YOU CAN JUST ROLL THE THUMB WHEEL INSTEAD OF HAVING TO GET YOUR CALCULATOR OUT & DOING THE MATH . I APPRECIATE YOUR TIME & HELP . THANK YOU GOD BLESS HAVE A BLESSED DAY
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I truly like this product even though it is not digital
customer_reviews.text: I truly like this product even though it is not digital. I bought this product because I don't really wanna worry about battery life and the precision is the same as digital. Reading it takes a while to get use to but to me this is consistent because I don't need to worry about calibration too much. The only issue is it is impossible to put it in a certain distance and turn it to zero to find negative and positive of a measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Abon

customer_reviews.title: Good bench caliper
customer_reviews.text: Not a high end caliper but pretty decent. Wish the case was a little easier to open. Some reviews complained that it doesn't zero out accurately but i find it holds fairly well for a few uses and needs to be set again. I found the same to be true with a set of Starretts that were much more money.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Big solid tool, but a little hard to read.
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool, feels well made, bigger and much heavier than I expected. I took off one star for the feeling that it could cut me if I am not very careful. I find it confusing to read, but this comes with the territory, two dials - one that spins twice per unit - is going to take a fair bit of practice to read quickly. Sorry to have to admit, my all time favorite caliper is the plastic 1/100" unit I got here.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Not Included. Or Required! ;-)
customer_reviews.text: I really like this caliper. The dual dial is kind of weird, but once used to it, it's good to have both readings. Main thing is it's well constructed, apparently accurate, easy to use and does not require batteries. The digital caliper I had before worked fine, but batteries never lasted, and I was always replacing batteries every time I used it. No batteries required here.
customer_reviews.author: RickR

customer_reviews.title: Good for light users
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dial caliper because I didn't have much confidence in my digital caliper. The numbers jumped around like there was a bad electric connection somewhere. With the mechanical dial caliper, I don't need batteries and unless there is a mechanical failure somewhere, it's going to be right. On the negative side, the numbers look like they would wear off failry easily. It would be nice if they were etched into the metal. Then again, I'm not a heavy user so they will probably serve me just fine.
customer_reviews.author: James Miller

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: A nice feeling caliper and accurate, good value caliper for the weekend mechanic!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G

customer_reviews.title: Brittle, like glass.
customer_reviews.text: Says it's shockproof, but it's not. I dropped mine about 6 inches and now it gets stuck a little past an inch. Waste of money. Never buying from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: No compromise.
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional. I use these all the time, and having both units is amazing. They come in a decent case too which is nice. I didn’t know if I’d use the extra precision over a digital caliper, but I’ve found it essential for making fine adjustments and making parts fit each other. I have absolutely no complaints about quality. Truly a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have high hopes but after playing with it I'm getting repeatable measurements and return to zero. The dual needles are kinda odd to get used to reading but they do the job. Compared it to a cheap digital and my mitutoyo dial caliper. It reads the same across the full 6 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Dial not stable
customer_reviews.text: When I open and close the caliper, the dials return to different positions.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ewart

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This seems well made; it operates smoothly and the thumb wheel actually turns. However, unless you need both inches and centimeters on the same caliper, I would just choose one and go with that because having two scales on the dial requires extra effort to read carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Darkit

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and accuracy for a hobby user.
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality at the price. Worth every penny over the H.F. brand with the battery. Purchased this to replace the HF brand with a battery that was dead every time I went to used it. I'm really happy with this upgrade and would recommend it to anybody as a Hobby user.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great caliper for the price
customer_reviews.text: Of course this thing isn't going to be as consistent as a $200 vernier caliper, but for $30, and with an easy-to-read dial, and with simultaneous inch and millimeter readouts, this is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Moomaw

customer_reviews.title: nice that it's both metric and standard
customer_reviews.text: Simple , easy to use and a good value... plus no batteries to change
customer_reviews.author: Losten Deforest

customer_reviews.title: Seems to maintain good accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool. It seems to be very accurate, as it zeros out consistently when the jaws are closed. No matter what, it's accurate enough for my purposes, which include measuring bike parts, mostly.
customer_reviews.author: andy1

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have used calipers a long time and I needed an extra one while staying away from home. This is fine but I had to get used to the dial and how it works. After a few times I got the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Emmet

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold zero
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few days, suddenly the dial does not return to zero when closing the caliper. Have to slide it back and forth briskly to "reset" it so it reads zero, then take a measurement and hope it's still accurate. Definitely not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F. Timmermans

customer_reviews.title: instructions goofy
customer_reviews.text: the how too read instructional paper is wrong. tool reads are easy and fast in both SI and metric. great product if i need another i will buy this brand. tool case takes getting used too too open.
customer_reviews.author: Neva

customer_reviews.title: Very well built. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised at how well built these calipers are. To be honest, I was expecting a flimsy tool and nearly talked myself out of ordering them. They are solid, and heavier than I expected. Dial is super easy to calibrate and use. Comes with a nice case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great caliper. I was using an electric one before which constantly needed recalibrating. This one is very accurate and does not need constant recalibrating. As other's have mentioned, the acrylic lens would probably be the only con since it can probably scratch easily.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you're looking for non-digital caliper in metric and English
customer_reviews.text: I don't use a caliper very often, but when I need one, I need it to work and I don't want to find out the battery is dead, or the battery is so old it has leaked and messed up the battery compartment, etc. So I wanted a simple no-battery-required caliper that measures in both inches and millimeters, and this one by AnytimeTools fits the bill perfectly. Stainless steel so it won't rust in your toolbox like cheaper ones, and it has a case to keep it protected.
customer_reviews.author: F. Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Roll the dice. Hit or miss.
customer_reviews.text: First one I received had to be sent back as it wouldn't open past .187". It also had no certification or guide. Returned. The second one I received works perfect and included certification and short guide. Just the case has some damage. I realize it's "double shock proof" but I plan on keeping it in the case when not in use. Could we package them a little better for shipping?
customer_reviews.author: LoganExplosion

customer_reviews.title: Super precise and well made!
customer_reviews.text: God I love this thing. Its precision is excellent and all of its pieces are so well made. Nothing is loose and I love having inch and millimeter conversion at the same time. No batteries to worry about either!
customer_reviews.author: Enjoying

customer_reviews.title: It's your competent with tools this is worth it
customer_reviews.text: What can you expect for the price? Honestly it's not the best but using your brain and most people can make this tool so the job of tools 2 or 3x the same price
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap case, poorly packaged.
customer_reviews.text: The case for this is the only drawback, it is cheap, non-impact resistant plastic that is poorly packaged by Amazon. The first one I received was cracked to bits. I sent it back for replacement and the second one had minor damage and cracks as well. I decided to live with it as the product itself is quite good for the price. The Mutitoyo I use at work has a nice impact resistant case.
customer_reviews.author: RetroMan

customer_reviews.title: It Measures Repeatably
customer_reviews.text: Killer quality and precision for the money. I may get another for the shop. I bought this one for the office when I have to measure an item before ordering online for a replacement. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: PHX Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the hobbies or professionals .. It.  Work
customer_reviews.text: Some review say ... It's. Not zeroed when closed ... Well 😁😁 read the manual ... U may have to fine tune it and zero it ..... The rest is very straight forward ... Just read the dials YouTube has videos on how to use 🏋🏿🏋🏿
customer_reviews.author: Taha Mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’m using to to measure for ammunition reloading, for which it is ideal. The zero tends to drift around slightly and repeatability is not perfect but for the money it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Grasshopper on Video Forums

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my use. I am not a machinist and I don’t need a high dollar piece of equipment. This fits my needs exactly and is not expensive. More than pleased with product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Solid set of dial calipers
customer_reviews.text: It works well, and keeps its measurement. Very weighty and solid feeling. The thumb screws are tight and feel nice, and the jaws are very solid and sharp as well. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Hugo S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Calipers!
customer_reviews.text: Calipers are great and precise enough for their intended use. I’ve had Swiss and Japanese made calipers... these are not on par with those in neither finish or precision. However, they do no cost $200 either. These are a fantastic value at the price point and are my go to when needing to see what size bolt or drill or whatever I’m dealing with.
customer_reviews.author: Mgaitan

customer_reviews.title: Best of the cheap ones I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Pretty dang accurate. Was reading similar to my American made micrometers down to .02mm. Love that there are two needles, standard and metric. No converting necessary! No detectable curve or bend to any of the items that should be straight. Only gripe, the sharpNess of the edges. Thing could cut you if ypu aren't careful. Nicer calibers usually have those sharp edges knocked down. Bottom line, for the price these are remarkable!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Good caliper - great value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality dial caliper for a reasonable cost. I really prefer a dial caliper over digital. Digital is nice, but I don't like the batteries going dead. Digital calipers are no more precise as they still rely on the mechanical action to feed the display. For me it's nice to know it is going to work when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Calipers work pretty well and are seem to be accurate compared to gauge blocks. The millimeter and inch scales are in near perfect alignment when doing the conversion back and forth. As I've stated in other reviews analog dials on calipers and micrometers are much better for accuracy than that of the cheaper or same cost digital calipers. It may take a little longer to get that measurement but yo don't have the chatter you get on digital calipers, even good digital calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool all around
customer_reviews.text: More and more metric measurement is creeping into the machining world. This does the job of measuring both metric and thousands of an inch. Its accuracy seems pretty good, to the .001, although I need to take several hundred readings to know if its good over the entire scale. I will up date this over time. At this point I recommend this tool for general shop work.
customer_reviews.author: working man

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT BUT BOX IS POORLY MADE AND DIFFICULT TO OPEN.
customer_reviews.text: GOOD PRODUCT BUT BOX IS POORLY MADE AND DIFFICULT TO OPEN.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it feels good and keeps it's accuracy pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I usually use Mitutoyo, but I got one that I didn't really have to care about too much for measurements where accuracy isn't vital, but I'm surprised at the quality of this tool. The only part that feels cheap to me is the plastic that covers the dial. Other than that it feels good and keeps it's accuracy pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: DaMaDo

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of measurement equipment for your toolbox
customer_reviews.text: This tool is excellent for machine tool use and measuring of different types of materials. The dual measurement combination on a tool that does not have the issue of coolant or cutting oil to result in errors is an excellent resource. Even with the new IP ratings of the electronic calipers cannot always prevent errors. The dual measurement at a glance is also helpful with being able to give either measurement to people around you or as results on documentation.
customer_reviews.author: C. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Guaged/calibrated within .0002" on all 4 sides, yes within tenths. Not as smooth as my $200 mitutoyo's but still for the price and getting good accuracy at least for the ones i got.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these calibers and I am very pleased with the quality and precision. Also the price is great. If I had to find fault with them, I would have to pick on the case, but that's my only minor issue. Overall, worth every penny. Scott D.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: This gives me the ability to measure both in metric and SAE with one tool. It is mechanically accurate and reliable... It requires NO batteries. the action isn't silky smooth like a $180 one would be, but it works every time I open my tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowjacket

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic concept and execution.
customer_reviews.text: One of my very favorite tools. Crisp, precise, smooth action. And the underlying concept of Imperial/Metric on the same dial face is just fantastic. These have become my "go-to" calipers over all the others I've ever owned. Were these to become lost or damaged, I'd be ordering another set, instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Danal

customer_reviews.title: Does just what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Does just what it says. I like having SAE and Metric dual scales. I measure in both units and do the math to prove they equal - this way, I am checking to be sure I have read the scale correctly. Very nice scale for people on a light budget.
customer_reviews.author: GA_dw

customer_reviews.title: I much prefer dial over digital.
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer dial over digital calipers, no batteries, no drift. Now I can measure in both freedom units and international units with a digital caliper. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic caliper. I can tare it protective box not the greatest quality. There are better calipers but great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Well built, high quality, no batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this tool for a couple years now and it's proven to be an invaluable asset to my 3D printing madness. I print scale models and practical household items and these calipers have never failed to deliver when fractions of a millimeter count! The build quality is excellent, and since it does not use batteries it ALWAYS works. Measure once, print once with this guy. I'd buy another one if anything ever happened to it.
customer_reviews.author: CoffeeHouse

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is a junk piece. There is zero repeatability. The needles were off after the first day of use. Zero is different every time I close the jaws. Buy something else. I measure the same part and 10 times and get 10 measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Seems quality built but has no fractional measurements.
customer_reviews.text: Seems quality built but has no fractional measurements which is more than handy in house construction in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: HerMan

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I am old school and not very trusting of digital mics this is nice for quick measurements and I’m not guessing if I zeroed it or calibrated it
customer_reviews.author: Bryant

customer_reviews.title: You’ll use it constantly even if you don’t think you will.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tool purchases I ever made. Helps in hundreds of ways during the week when you need some tiny measurement that you used to just guess about. Invaluable for RC cars and such, which I wasn’t expecting. For all my other hobbies as well, it’s just the thing when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT value.  Don't spend more.
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing all the time when installing gun parts. I don't treat it particularly well, but it has held up and is just as accurate as calipers for three times the price. I like the one with the dial, because I like to see the hand move. I suppose a digital one would work just a well. Well made, and no play in the machining.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Z

customer_reviews.title: Good price, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool a lot, it's accurate and reads in both inch and metric and there's no battery to go dead!
customer_reviews.author: Tech X

customer_reviews.title: Really high-quality and precise dial caliper at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my small business based on all the great product reviews. Wow this dial caliper is really well made as people stated. The quality has to be rivaling high-end models. Really nice machined stainless body and quality dial that has a geared measuring ratio that has a black (Imperial) needle and red (Metric) needle. Really well worth the price. Also included a (hinged) black plastic case with nice foam insert for the tool.
customer_reviews.author: S Wentz

customer_reviews.title: Measure your wallet....
customer_reviews.text: This is a good solid tool I'm a everyday mutt,so this can sit in my toolbox without worrying about a battery If you like the battery operation one ..Super I measured my wallet after buying this item ( for the quality,this was a good price) didn't go down much in thickness
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like it was made of quality materials despite mine being ...
customer_reviews.text: The one i received would not zero and grinded as i moved it to take measurements. Sent back and bought a different one. Seemed like it was made of quality materials despite mine being defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the money!!! NICE!
customer_reviews.text: I've only put light use on it, but it's accurate, repeatable, and seems durable. I'll see how long this one last, but for now, this seems like a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Floaty.

customer_reviews.title: They're as accurate as I need
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to work with my 3D printer. I'm from the US so the conversion to metric is a bit of a struggle but these have made the transition pretty easy. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Terry C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for reloading
customer_reviews.text: Good set of calipers for the money. I don't need anything that is extremely precise and these were in my budget. I use them just for reloading so they're perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Precise, consistent, good fit and finish, and a great value!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive but highly precise calipers. I find the fit and finish of the units to be really very good. I have check this pair against some high dollar dial and digital calipers and they are dead on. I also like the dual read feature (inch and cm). I showed this to one of my coworkers and he ended up ordering several...he is just as impressed as I am. Great value and a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: The Yoginator

customer_reviews.title: JUST DON"T DROP IT !
customer_reviews.text: This caliper is accurate over its length, easy to read and priced very reasonable. HOWEVER DO NOT DROP IT !! I have now bought 2 of them and unfortunately dropped both of them. Each time this has knocked out the alignment of the timing of the dial drive. It says "Shockproof" on the dial face, however I have now proven conclusively this is not so.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Seem accurate. Dual dimension is great
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the quality for the price. Glides smooth and comes back to the same number every time. Being able to measure metric and imperial is great. I design a lot of parts and need to know what size item they may match up to. If it metric you know exactly what size to make. No rounding or doing conversions.
customer_reviews.author: M. Blakey

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of Calipers
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of calipers. The dual dial on the face is great, it reads in both Inches and in Millimeters. I have checked it against a grade II set of gauge blocks and it has no problem reporting the number accurately. Accurate to within 0.001". Good enough for me and my woodworking at home. Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: is very good
customer_reviews.text: I needed a caliper and had another one that was previously digital, but I had a lot of problems because it went out a lot; With this I do not fear problems because I have the pressure I need and I know that it will never go out.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Nice calipers man.
customer_reviews.text: These calipers are very well made and so far have kept their calibration. They have a good heft to them and have no looseness of play to the construction of them. I very much appreciate having both the Metric and Inches on the dial as sometimes I am lazy and don't feel like doing the conversion myself.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this purchase as they meet my needs
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase as they meet my needs. If I was doing laboratory precision work I would have gotten a higher grade of product but for my relatively simple tasks this tool is just fine. It did take me a minute to realize that all I had to do to get the dial to zero-out was to turn the outer case. A good value for the money. The killer is that you can buy digital ones from Harbor Freight for 1/3 of the cost of this item but if you are old-school like me and want to see the measurement then these are the ticket for you. Kevin L.
customer_reviews.author: KACL

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Works just fine and no batteries needed I had a digital and I was sorry I didn't buy a dial caliper. There's a bit of a learning curve but even this cave man gets it.
customer_reviews.author: brokeboater

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and fragile
customer_reviews.text: The rack got nicked from a drop of about 4 inches onto wood. It developed backlash problems after that. Save time and buy something of even marginal quality.
customer_reviews.author: P. roddy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This isn't an instrument you would use in a machine shop but it also isn't over $200. For use around the garage at home, this is an absolute steal. Great price and great product for garage use.
customer_reviews.author: Gumby

product_meta.title: Anytime Tools Dial Caliper 6" / 150mm DUAL Reading Scale METRIC SAE Standard INCH MM
feature_bullets: Dial face reads in both inch (black) and metric (red).
Inside, outside, step and depth measurement.
Raised sliding surface prevents wear and defacement of graduations.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars701 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
